mapper.select: select la.id ,la.emp_id ,la.check_id ,la.content ,la.start_date ,la.end_date ,la.leave_date ,la.create_date ,la.check_date ,la.check_flag ,la.cost_salary ,la.is_cost ,la.leave_type ,e3.nick_name AS straightLeaderName ,la.straight_leader ,bo.corp_man AS deptLeader ,e1.nick_name AS empNAME ,bo.org_name AS empDept ,e2.nick_name AS checkName from emp_leave_apply la LEFT JOIN employee e1 ON e1.id = la.emp_id LEFT join basic_org bo on e1.dept_no = bo.org_no LEFT JOIN employee e2 ON e2.id = la.check_id LEFT JOIN employee e3 ON e3.id = la.straight_leader where la.id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

select
from emp_leave_apply where 1=1
and emp_id = #{empId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
and DATE_FORMAT(create_date,'%Y-%m-%d') >= DATE_FORMAT(#{startDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},'%Y-%m-%d')
and DATE_FORMAT(create_date,'%Y-%m-%d') <= DATE_FORMAT(#{endDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},'%Y-%m-%d')
and DATE_FORMAT(create_date,'%Y-%m-%d') >= DATE_FORMAT(#{propsMap.startDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},'%Y-%m-%d')
and DATE_FORMAT(create_date,'%Y-%m-%d') <= DATE_FORMAT(#{propsMap.endDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},'%Y-%m-%d')
